criteria: Ability to generate a number or shape pattern following a given rule.
Ability to identify apparent features of the pattern not explicit in the rule.
Ability to explain informally why the identified features will continue in the pattern.
descriptions: Student cannot generate any terms in the sequence or pattern.
Student can generate only the first few terms of the sequence or pattern with significant errors.
Student can generate some terms in the sequence or pattern, but with some errors or inconsistencies.
Student can generate most terms in the sequence or pattern correctly, with only minor errors.
Student can accurately generate the terms in the sequence or pattern following the given rule.
Student can fluently and accurately generate the terms in the sequence or pattern following the given rule.
Student cannot identify any features of the pattern beyond the rule.
Student attempts to identify features but provides incorrect or irrelevant observations.
Student identifies some basic features of the pattern, but misses more subtle or complex aspects.
Student identifies several apparent features of the pattern, but may struggle to explain them clearly.
Student identifies most of the key features of the pattern that were not explicit in the rule.
Student comprehensively identifies and articulates all relevant features of the pattern, demonstrating a deep understanding.
Student provides no explanation or an incorrect explanation.
Student attempts an explanation, but it is unclear, incomplete, or contains significant errors.
Student offers a partial explanation, but it lacks clarity or supporting reasoning.
Student provides a reasonable explanation for why the features continue, but could benefit from more detail or precision.
Student clearly explains why the identified features will continue in the pattern using logical reasoning.
Student provides a thorough and insightful explanation, demonstrating a strong grasp of the underlying mathematical principles influencing the pattern.
